intro: Mentha moenchii, commonly known as Mexican mint or wild mint, is a perennial herb native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant has square, hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its small, tubular flowers are typically blue or violet, arranged in whorled clusters. Mentha moenchii is valued for its strong menthol scent and is used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb.
